item.content:encoded:
Got another new project yesterday, I will have to improve the performance of registration letter, which has pretty high failure rate on gmail. Actually gmail has less than 10% market share but what I was told is that all gmail users are sort of ‚Äúopinion leader‚Äù, which means they actively blogging, or as a journalist, or whatever.

gmail believes they are cool, they don‚Äôt follow most of the conventions in this mail industry. However, since they take themselves as a hi-tech company, I‚Äôm going to solve this problem in hi-tech way.

Or, maybe I‚Äôm wrong ‚Äì to beat hi-tech companies, you always need to use low-tech skills

item.title: Trouble with Windows Live Messenger
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: I‚Äôve been having trouble in launching Windows Live Messenger for quite some time and I had to use Pidgin to connect to my MSN buddies, finally (today) I decided to solve this problem and here is the quick solution: http://www.truecombatelite.com/forums/viewtopic.php?p=26227&sid=d7f42bc042a2595f68b3ec3b98f08262 I‚Äôve tried and it works perfectly ‚Äì after deleting the registry key under group HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\MSNMessenger\PerPassportSettings, [...]
item.content:encoded:
I‚Äôve been having trouble in launching Windows Live Messenger for quite some time and I had to use Pidgin to connect to my MSN buddies, finally (today) I decided to solve this problem and here is the quick solution:

http://www.truecombatelite.com/forums/viewtopic.php?p=26227&sid=d7f42bc042a2595f68b3ec3b98f08262

I‚Äôve tried and it works perfectly ‚Äì after deleting the registry key under group HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\MSNMessenger\PerPassportSettings, my Windows Live Messenger came back to work.

I haven‚Äôt read through though, not sure what‚Äôs the story beind.
